up this not so much so why do our

which points to us evolutionary

these wrinkles are rain treads their to

the skin on your fingers has a protein

that makes your hair so strong and it's
what allows the wrinkles to form keratin
strong because it's woven together in a

do this but back in the pool what's

your brain that's because finger
wrinkling is an autonomic response like
this or this even though you're not
thinking about it your brain knows
things get slippery when wet and tells

was really important 10,000 years ago
when we needed to snatch piranhas out of

our fingers wrinkle today it's no longer
for survival but it does make it a lot
easier to get out of that tub
